                            <gmd:role>

                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>

                                <gco:CharacterString>Maritime Aboriginal Peoples Council</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Comparative Assessment of Ecological Conditions for Atlantic Salmon in the Northern Minas Basin Rivers, colloquially the “Atlantic Salmon Comparative Assessment Project” is a multi-year initiative funded through the aquatic Aboriginal Fund for Species at Risk (AFSAR) by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO), to investigate the survival of the endangered inner Bay of Fundy (iBoF) Atlantic salmon fry in Critical Habitat rivers (Debert, Folly, Great Village, Portapique, and Economy Rivers) in the Cobequid Bay, of the Northern Minas Basin, Nova Scotia.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

                <gmd:MD_ProgressCode 
                codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" 
                codeListValue="onGoing">onGoing</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>
            </gmd:status>

                            codeListValue="weekly">weekly</gmd:MD_MaintenanceFrequencyCode>

            </gmd:resourceMaintenance>

                    </gmd:keyword>

            </gmd:descriptiveKeywords>
            
            
            
            <gmd:resourceConstraints>
                <gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                            </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>
                            <gmd:southBoundLatitude>

                            </gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                            <gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>45.533829</gco:Decimal>

                    </gmd:verticalElement>
                </gmd:EX_Extent>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-1a6b-g984
notes: The Comparative Assessment of Ecological Conditions for Atlantic Salmon in the Northern Minas Basin Rivers, colloquially the “Atlantic Salmon Comparative Assessment Project” is a multi-year initiative funded through the aquatic Aboriginal Fund for Species at Risk (AFSAR) by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO), to investigate the survival of the endangered inner Bay of Fundy (iBoF) Atlantic salmon fry in Critical Habitat rivers (Debert, Folly, Great Village, Portapique, and Economy Rivers) in the Cobequid Bay, of the Northern Minas Basin, Nova Scotia.

notes_translated.en: The Comparative Assessment of Ecological Conditions for Atlantic Salmon in the Northern Minas Basin Rivers, colloquially the “Atlantic Salmon Comparative Assessment Project” is a multi-year initiative funded through the aquatic Aboriginal Fund for Species at Risk (AFSAR) by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO), to investigate the survival of the endangered inner Bay of Fundy (iBoF) Atlantic salmon fry in Critical Habitat rivers (Debert, Folly, Great Village, Portapique, and Economy Rivers) in the Cobequid Bay, of the Northern Minas Basin, Nova Scotia.
notes_translated.fr: L'évaluation comparative des conditions écologiques du saumon de l'Atlantique dans les rivières du nord du bassin des Mines, communément appelée « Projet d'évaluation comparative du saumon de l'Atlantique », est une initiative pluriannuelle financée par le Fonds autochtone aquatique pour les espèces en péril (AFSAR) de Pêches et Océans Canada (MPO), visant à étudier la survie des alevins de saumon atlantique de l'intérieur de la baie de Fundy (IBof), en voie de disparition dans les rivières constituant un habitat essentiel (Debert, Folly, Great Village, Portapique, et Economy Rivers) dans la baie de Cobequid, dans le nord du bassin des Mines, en Nouvelle-Écosse.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: A Comparative Assessment of Ecological Conditions for Atlantic Salmon in the Northern Minas Basin

title_translated.en: A Comparative Assessment of Ecological Conditions for Atlantic Salmon in the Northern Minas Basin
title_translated.fr: Évaluation comparative des conditions écologiques du saumon de l'Atlantique dans le nord du bassin des Mines

title_translation_method.fr: Title text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate
